text: Working on a little utility to speed up out front-end tasks and have a question for you:

How common is it for the font size/line-height ratio of a paragraph to change as the the font size changes. In other words, if we're working on a responsive site with a paragraph of 16/24px (1.5 ratio) and the font size changes to 15, 14, and 13 as the window shrinks, would you use the 1.5 on the new sizes?
Based on the last few web projects we worked on I haven't seen us deviate much from the original ratio provided in the comp but wanted to confirm that with the rest of the design team.
Ratio is solid, and usually pretty standardized. So for small changes — 15, 14, 13 — i could see that being a real help. The only thing that upsets the apple cart a bit is when line length changes.
going from really long to really short (in mobile) may need a new ratio. but yeah, good start
Yes <@U026PLK4S>, line length change was the first thing I thought of. I'll keep that in mind.
